definitions.text: the vital principle or animating force within living things
the general atmosphere of a place or situation and the effect that it has on people
examples: the feel of the city excited him
a clergyman improved the tone of the meeting
it had the smell of treason

definitions.text: a fundamental emotional and activating principle determining one's character
any incorporeal supernatural being that can become visible (or audible) to human beings
the state of a person's emotions (especially with regard to pleasure or dejection)
examples: his emotional state depended on her opinion

definitions.text: the intended meaning of a communication
animation and energy in action or expression
examples: it was a heavy play and the actors tried in vain to give life to it

definitions.text: an inclination or tendency of a certain kind
examples: he had a change of heart
